TITLE: 2005 ford taurus
ATTR: fuel: gas#odometer: 253000#title status: clean#transmission: automatic
MESSAGE: for sale is my 2005 ford taurus with 253xxx miles on it.  the car does look like its age and mileage; but it does start and drive.  i bought the car from a friend whose family owned it in northern michigan; who then sold it to me.  i have only owned the car since may; so i havent put many miles on it.  only reason i am selling is because i bought another vehicle.  i do not need to sell.  yes; i know the car is rough; which is why it is priced where it is.#good:#radio works; starts and runs; new wheel cylinders in the rear; new starter.#bad:#there is a hole in the drivers side floorboard a little bigger then a baseball; and there is only about half of the floor on the passengers side.  car is very rusty; and looks awful.  when the windshield is sprayed; sometimes a burning smell comes shortly after.  that is because there is a leak in the hose; and the washer fluid drops onto the motor.  after the car has been running a while; it shifts real hard out of first gear; and my friends said that when he drove it from detroit back to northern michigan; by the time it got off the freeway the car would not leave first gear until you let the car sit for a while.  car has a misfire on cylinders 1; 2 and 3 (i think its a bad head gasket; given the cylinders are all on the same bank).  im sure there is more; but i cant remember.  there is a reason the car is priced where it is.#for its condition and mileage; the car doesnt run too bad.  car was driven daily up until june 9nth.#please text or call me at 248 eight three eight 8 zero eight 2 between 3:30 pm and 9:00 pm during the week; and anytime on the weekend.  i do have class twice a week; so if i do not answer or respond immediately; i will get back to you as soon as i can.  any questions feel free to ask.  will also consider trades.  give me an offer; the worst i can do is say no.

MESSAGE: well taken care of auto. my brother (who is a very good mech.) bought this car from village ford in 2006 with 22;000 mi and drove it to 157;000. i bought it for my daughter in sept of 2013 and she drove it to 215;000 all the while getting regular maintenance and oil changes. some of the maintenance includes -- new master cylinder; rear brakes and both rear wheel cylinders on 9/4/14; new air conditioning compressor 6/27/16; new left front hub bearing 7/5/16; new alternator; rear struts; rear brake drums; rear brake shoes; and battery on 8/24/16; new starter motor on 9/21/16; heater hose assembly and anti freeze service on 11/1/16; new front rotors and pads on 6/20/17; new firestone firehawk all season performance radials put on 5/17; front end alignment done at belle tire in summer of 2016. this taurus does not blow blue oil smoke out the tail pipe; mainly because it has been taken care of. this car is a good driver and wouldnt have put over 3;600 dollars in repairs if i didnt think car was worth it. yes in has a lot of miles but this car has been well taken care of and still has many miles to go. i gave my daughter my ford fusion so this one is up for sale. car still appears nice and does have some rust around the rear wheel wells (show me a taurus of that year that doesnt) v6 automatic; car has working electric sunroof; a nice kenwood after market radio with usb and other plugins with remote; power steering and brakes; power mirrors; keyless entry; tilt steering wheel; lit vanity mirrors; working power windows; grey leather interior; folding center console so three people can sit up front if you wish; working icy cold air conditioning; rear defroster; information center showing miles to empty ect.; floor mats ft and rear; remote trunk release; have two remote key fobs and two keys. when i changed tires i kept the best tire with plenty of tread for a spare in case of a tire becoming damaged and beyond repair; it is in the trunk. clean interior and ready to go. front seat did have sheep skin covers but need to be cleaned and they are in the trunk. no major accidents while owned by me or my brother.

TITLE: 2009 ford taurus sel
ATTR: VIN: 1FAHP24W69G104690#condition: good#cylinders: 6 cylinders#drive: fwd#fuel: gas#odometer: 124000#paint color: white#size: full-size#title status: clean#transmission: automatic#type: sedan
MESSAGE: clean interior just detailed. heat and air conditioning work; automatic; doors; locks; windows; seats; am/fm radio with cd; wood paneling and digital clock for a luxury feel. v6 engine. fwd split folding rear seats. 4 brand new tires.#the sel model is powered by a 3.5-liter v-6 engine mated to a 6-speed automatic transmission. standard equipment on the base model includes an am/fm cd audio system with an mp3 input jack; climate control with rear-seat ducts; power drivers seat; fold-flat front passenger seat; extra sound insulation; halogen headlamps; and 17-inch wheels. the ford taurus sel and taurus limited with front- or all-wheel drive include more standard amenities such as a trip computer; leather and woodgrain trim and touches; power drivers seat; 17-inch aluminum wheels; premium audio system; automatic climate control; and sirius satellite radio.;#powertrain#the 2009 ford taurus is powered by a 3.5-liter v-6 engine producing 263 hp and 249 lb.-ft. of torque. it is mated to a 6-speed automatic transmission. the large family sedan earns a pzev (partial zero-emission vehicle) rating from the epa. fuel economy is estimated at 18 mpg city/28 mpg highway with front-wheel drive; and 17 mpg city/27 mpg highway with all-wheel drive.#safety#dual front air bags; seat-mounted front side air bags; and side curtain air bags for both rows are standard on every 2009 ford taurus. other standard safety features include traction control; abs; stability control; power-adjustable pedals; and an sos-post crash alert system that unlocks doors and activates the horn and emergency flashers if the air bags are deployed in an accident. a reverse collision sensing system is optional.#in national highway traffic safety administration (nhtsa) testing; the 2009 ford taurus earned 5-star ratings (the administrations highest rating) for all occupants in frontal and side-impact crash tests and 4 stars for rollover resistance. as mentioned earlier; the iihs hasnt rated the 2009 model yet; but the 2008 model with stability control was named a top safety pick by the institute.#technology#fords sync voice-activated hands-free communication and entertainment system; developed jointly with microsoft; is standard on the 2009 taurus limited and optional on sel models. sync integrates cell phones and media players; such as the mp3 player; with the vehicle using bluetooth technology and usb connectivity. sync-equipped taurus models feature an electro-chromic rearview mirror with compass and microphone features.
